intro: Crotalaria huillensis var. cacondensis, commonly known as the Huillén crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in regions of Peru and Ecuador. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. It has been studied for its potential ecological roles and traditional uses in local communities. Its morphology and distribution make it an interesting subject for botanical research.
